metadata.name: Allégories booléennes #374
metadata.description:
"Allégories booléennes" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at PARIS+ par Art Basel

This work is a continuation of research around the intersections of shapes that I have been exploring for a while. I wonder about the way in which they make it possible to bring out new compositions from superpositions of shapes that could initially represent a real disorder.

Controls:
• "a": Play the animation
• "s": Export the image (default 2160 × 3840px PNG)
• "h": Change export settings to high resolution (then press "s" to export a 6480 ×11520px PNG)
• "m": Change export settings to medium resolution (then press "s" to export a 4320 × 7680px PNG)
• "n": Back to 2160 × 3840px

Artwork by Julien Espagnon, 2022.

metadata.name: Diyalebuka #4
metadata.description:
Diyalebuka - "Thank you"! 

With this piece I hope to express my thanks and joy for being alive and able to create art. I hope the patterns and textures will bring you joy.

This piece is inspired by the patterns of the Ndebele of Southern Africa and the First Nations Salish of Vancouver Island.

* There are over 100 palettes arranged into 6 distinct families
* There can be between 2 and 10 bars

(The artwork will fit your available window and may take a while to generate if it's a larger resolution)

metadata.name: fxApe #458
metadata.description:
fxApe
Art by Littlesilver
Code by Nicthib and Mark Knol

This project borrows assets from BAYC #8082 as permitted by ownership copyright, but is not affiliated with BAYC in any way. Big thanks to Ciphrd for permitting the use of fxhash logos and also in no particular order to Yazid, M.J. Lindow, Andreas Rau, Lisa Orth, Punevyr, Jim The Bim, William Zancan, Random Combo, Ciphrd, Sableraph, wblut, Mark Knol, Landlinesart and again Ciphrd for giving permission to take inspiration from or directly use their art.

Dedicated to the whole fxhash community and in particular to people that ape in.

metadata.name: Herbarium #468
metadata.description:
"Herbarium" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022

Occasionally, I stumble upon vintage scientific illustrations on various topics, exotically looking charts and graphs, alternative layouts for the periodic tables or psychological research diagrams, elaborate illustrations of botany and zoology, minerals, and natural and sometimes unnatural phenomena. Most of those illustrations are part of the "art and science" practices from the 18th and 19th centuries. At the core of those practices were observation and interpretation, unraveling complexity through visualizing abstract ideas or finding a creative approach for understanding previously incomprehensible forms. 

I'm an admirer of two female pioneers in the field. Maria Sibylla Merian created, with immense dedication, a book with intricate illustrations of plants and insects, later praised by scientists. On the other hand, Anna Atkins published a book with beautiful botanical cyanotypes, considered the first book with photographic images. These topics are the visual inspiration for pieces presented at ArtBasel HK. 

My mathematical background makes me naturally attracted to graphs, converting numbers to curves, and everything schematically displayed. Also, combining scientific symbols and illustrations with imaginary data inspires the spectator to find meaning in unrelated or random things or provokes latent skepticism towards assumed concepts of truth, reality, and knowledge.

metadata.name: Paper Emblems #480
metadata.description:
The year is 2335, long after 90% of the earth's surface turned to arid, uninhabitable desert, people have once again formed small insular militaristic societies. Each faction within these societies shows allegiance to their respective post-neo-oligarchic clans via displays of color within the faction' emblem. The emblems, being representative of the fickle nature of these alliances are made but of simple paper. Folded, cut, and easily dyed allowing for switching clan allegiance at a moments notice should an advantageous situation present itself.

6 possible color palettes.

Click / tap to save a .png || may take a few seconds on mobile, just tap once and it should download just fine. ;)

Created by devgenart, 2022, with p5js

metadata.name: Simulated Reality #172
metadata.description: Why can't I escape?

metadata.name: De Stijl #191
metadata.description:
This project is a playful attempt to depict how Neo-plasticism painters abstracted compositions, inspired and a tribute to the "De Stijl" movement, drawn using statically rendered block elements. The visual language reminds the original designs of famous artists of this art movement; in this project, each color palette is categorized by the name of a favorite piece of these artists. These palettes are sometimes determined by the color combination of this artist's works, which form the visual identity of their works from the color dimension.
In this project, different nodes are simple orthogonal shapes of color spots and thin lines to demarcate colors. I tried to create a dynamic effect by questioning the usual signs of vision in the abstract works of this period, to modify the relationship between them profoundly, and to show another field of my understanding of this movement by drawing a personal space.
The colors red, black, blue, and yellow were used from this turning point in the Neo-plasticism that the artists of the 'De Stijl movement cared about.
Subtle black lines separate the vast rectangles, which for some are filled with bright or black, or gray; each small component is a member to create a whole and a single visualization, and each aspect of the components receives its visual value from the whole.
This work has set 27 color palettes and three variations to shape different rarities. It is better to set the browser to standard mode to see the effect better.

De Stijl
 
The style "De Stijl" of the Dutch avant-garde movement is an essential key to understanding the sources of the modern movement. The movement is organized around three central figures: the painter Piet Mondrian and Theo van Doesburg and the furniture designer and architect Gerrit Rietveld. Other core members are the painters Bart van der Leck, Georges Vantongerlo, and Willmus Huzar; the architects J.J.P Oud, Robert van Hoff, and Jan Wills; the poet Anthony Cook, later the graphic designer Piet Zwart and the architect Cornelis van Stern.
In 1918, a year after the official founding of the group and publication of the magazine's first issue that published and publicized the movement's doctrine, the creators of De Stijl combined the aesthetic and social vision. The group's first manifesto calls for a new balance between the individual and the universal and fights to free art from the limitations of the cult of individualism. 
 
De Stijl originates both in the Hegelian tradition and in the Theosophical movement, then spreading in the Netherlands, both a utopian vision and a commitment to the production of the reality of the industrial world. However, it is a formal, plastic, pictorial, or architectural transcription of the principles of universal harmony that its creators implement. Painting, sculpture, furniture design, graphic design, architecture, and soon urban planning support this experiment, carried out simultaneously by different group creators. De Style productions naturally go beyond the traditional and academic division between primary and secondary arts, decorative arts, architecture, and urban planning.
From the realm of the mind to the city, this can be the guiding thread for the evolution of the Style's productions during its fourteen years of life. The spatial nature of the work of art gradually reaches from the status of supporting the analysis of the world to a factor in building the social and political environment of the city. In this way, the spatialization of the work forms an experience of the world, gives order to the world, and gives essence to society. 
The Style's priority is to invent an official language that responds to the challenges of the industrial society after World War I and outlines strategies for implementing the new social order.
The method of this vision is Neo-plasticism, which initially consists in radicalizing the approach of the contemporary avant-gardes.

metadata.name: 🔸WOMAN 🔹LIFE🔹 FREEDOM🔸 #1255
metadata.description:
📅 To be recorded in history as the first event-based stamp collection of generative art on the blockchain. 

🟩🟩🟩🟩🟩
⬜️⬜️⬜️⬜️⬜️
🟥🟥🟥🟥🟥

🔆The people of my country – Iran - have been chanting three words for several days: 🔸Woman🔸🔹Life🔸🔸Freedom🔸.

🟢For over forty years, we have fought for these beautiful words. Today, our most basic human rights are being ignored in Iran, and we fight for them every day. In my land, women fight and die but do not accept humiliation. Women and men stand shoulder to shoulder and fight together.

🟢I published this collection of 1401 generative tokens to show my support for the people of Iran. 401 tokens are reserved for other known supporters of this cause, and 1000 tokens are free to mint.

🟢All my works about Iran's freedom are royalty-free and will always be. Due to fxhash's limitation on royalty selection, I have selected it all for the minter.

✅After completing the token animation, you can save the image in the following sizes and apply the following color filters: 

⌨️ SPACE key   ⏩ No Animation
⌨️ "r"   key   🔁 Reset All Filters
⌨️ "c"   key   ▶️  Random Tint Mode
⌨️ "g"   key   ▶️  Grayscale Mode
⌨️ "t"   key   ▶️  Black & White Mode (Normal)
⌨️ "y"   key   ▶️  Black & White Mode (Darker)
⌨️ "u"   key   ▶️  Black & White Mode (Brighter)
⌨️ "i"   key   ▶️  Invert Mode
⌨️ "p"   key   ▶️  Random Posterized Mode

⌨️ Key number  1️⃣  1000✖️1000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  2️⃣  2000✖️2000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  3️⃣  3000✖️3000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  4️⃣  4000✖️4000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  5️⃣  5000✖️5000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  6️⃣  6000✖️6000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  7️⃣  7000✖️7000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  8️⃣  8000✖️8000 pixels
⌨️ Key number  0️⃣  16000✖️16000 pixels

🅿️5️⃣ Built with p5js

🔆Generative art by Arash

metadata.name: Scaffold #11
metadata.description:
The thoughts we have are rarely as ordered as the words we speak and the actions we take are shaped by expectation and conditioning.

As we grow up, we are taught to behave or even think in a certain way. We learn what is acceptable and what is not. Our thoughts are forced to align with the structure imposed upon us.

Scaffold is an attempt to visually explore this concept of thoughts and control. Each output represents a state of mind at a particular moment in time.

Palettes have been mostly named by my family based on the first word they thought of when they saw them.

Keyboard commands:

s - save as png
h - toggle high resolution 
b - toggle background texture
a - switch aspect ratio
r - new moment

metadata.name: Congestionated #6
metadata.description:
'Congestionated' 
By Eduxdux June/22

p5.js and p5.scribbles

metadata.name: Antiflow #423
metadata.description:
"Opposites are not contradictory but complementary." - Niels Bohr

The concept of yin and yang is an ancient philosophy about how opposing forces are not only complementary but actually give rise to each other. This idea reverberates through nature, art, and life itself. Now it is at the heart of modern physics. Perhaps this is a fundamental law of nature baked into the very fabric of existence.

Antiflow is an exploration of how balanced complexity can arise from chaos by harnessing the dynamic interplay of opposing forces. To that end we were inspired to create this wildly unique set by mixing modern physics concepts with abstract expressionism and retro 3D primitives.

The aspect ratio is 3:2 to facilitate poster size prints and device wallpapers. Results are presented without borders, noise, or other effects to allow for maximum detail. Feel free to rotate in whatever direction you choose for the best display.

Press "S" to save at a higher definition.
tags: chaos opposites retro expressionist antiparticle flow p5js

metadata.name: Abstract Memories #157
metadata.description:
I try to explore the unknown nature of objects in an emotional abstraction. Instead of imposing an entirely personal feeling on the canvas, I draw something out of the canvas with the tools of expressive abstraction and color contrast. The content of an abstract painting completely bypasses all those mental filters. Abstract painting is the revelation of the inner life of the human soul; it transforms from words to visual identity. The abstract painting speaks the language of the imaginary world, a language that struggles with complexities.
I have always been interested in laying out patterns on the flat surface of the canvas and deciding how to cut and relate the frame to those elements on my design page. This focus is created through the influence of unpredictable handprints, batik prints, watercolors, and other oriental objects in my works. The desire for this decorative approach led me to cut the three-dimensional environment into a repeating flat pattern so that the rhythm of the shapes emphasizes the strong structure. Also, my attempt to use contrasting colors right next to each other - warm reds and oranges against great neutral greens, blues, and grays - is influenced by the challenging thinking of color and the lightness of impressionism in my work, where pure colors "in a reflection in mind And the contrast makes them even more vivid. They are precisely like the works we enjoy in the real world of reflected light. They can be easily overlooked in the dull colors of a canvas or on a productive work page; these contrasts and complementary color silences side by side. , create a magnificent symphony of colors.
I try to explore the unknown nature of objects in an emotional abstraction. Instead of imposing an entirely personal feeling on the canvas, I draw something out of the canvas with the tools of expressive abstraction and color contrast. The content of an abstract painting completely bypasses all those mental filters. Abstract painting is the revelation of the inner life of the human soul; it transforms from words to visual identity. The abstract painting speaks the language of the imaginary world, a language that struggles with complexities.
These types of art provide humanity with a background voice that profoundly soothes and heals our souls precisely because it is not figurative and, therefore, malleable and defined visually. An abstract painter seeks to depict the world around us in a way that is not what we see, but the message is that "this is what the world feels like." An abstract work puts the viewer in a position to create an interactive experience with the art by giving them the freedom to say, "this is for me."Looking at this work, we see pieces of colors and shapes you might imagine in a moment Gustav Klimt's Kiss, René Magritte's Golconde, etc. The ability of abstraction goes through the history of art and the human mind and remembers each one with hints.

To spread the vibe of my beautiful community, minters will own 50% of the royalty on each secondary sale.
Twenty-two different color palettes and three different borders with random colors are used in this artwork.
Made in p5js
Created September 2022
Artist: @ChistaAi

metadata.name: Abstract Memories #75
metadata.description:
I try to explore the unknown nature of objects in an emotional abstraction. Instead of imposing an entirely personal feeling on the canvas, I draw something out of the canvas with the tools of expressive abstraction and color contrast. The content of an abstract painting completely bypasses all those mental filters. Abstract painting is the revelation of the inner life of the human soul; it transforms from words to visual identity. The abstract painting speaks the language of the imaginary world, a language that struggles with complexities.
I have always been interested in laying out patterns on the flat surface of the canvas and deciding how to cut and relate the frame to those elements on my design page. This focus is created through the influence of unpredictable handprints, batik prints, watercolors, and other oriental objects in my works. The desire for this decorative approach led me to cut the three-dimensional environment into a repeating flat pattern so that the rhythm of the shapes emphasizes the strong structure. Also, my attempt to use contrasting colors right next to each other - warm reds and oranges against great neutral greens, blues, and grays - is influenced by the challenging thinking of color and the lightness of impressionism in my work, where pure colors "in a reflection in mind And the contrast makes them even more vivid. They are precisely like the works we enjoy in the real world of reflected light. They can be easily overlooked in the dull colors of a canvas or on a productive work page; these contrasts and complementary color silences side by side. , create a magnificent symphony of colors.
I try to explore the unknown nature of objects in an emotional abstraction. Instead of imposing an entirely personal feeling on the canvas, I draw something out of the canvas with the tools of expressive abstraction and color contrast. The content of an abstract painting completely bypasses all those mental filters. Abstract painting is the revelation of the inner life of the human soul; it transforms from words to visual identity. The abstract painting speaks the language of the imaginary world, a language that struggles with complexities.
These types of art provide humanity with a background voice that profoundly soothes and heals our souls precisely because it is not figurative and, therefore, malleable and defined visually. An abstract painter seeks to depict the world around us in a way that is not what we see, but the message is that "this is what the world feels like." An abstract work puts the viewer in a position to create an interactive experience with the art by giving them the freedom to say, "this is for me."Looking at this work, we see pieces of colors and shapes you might imagine in a moment Gustav Klimt's Kiss, René Magritte's Golconde, etc. The ability of abstraction goes through the history of art and the human mind and remembers each one with hints.

Created September 2022
Artist: @ChistaAi

metadata.name: Why? #91
metadata.description:
The direction taken by the artwork Why? was taken when contemplating a canvas filled with what could be viewed as huge stone steps. I added the small stick people - were they climbing up or down? Where were they going? Where did they come from?
I then became interested in how subtle changes of background colour and changes of balloon colour changed the story, or the feeling of the story - ranging from bright hope to despair and futility. 

All p5.js.
The artwork is rendered at window size, use keys '2' and '3' to render larger.

metadata.name: GEN XYZ Das Occult #9796
metadata.description:
A 10k Generative Profile Pic collection
GEN XYZ Das Occult - by culla - @tamccullough

move over cryptopunks
there is a new group on the scene

100% code - not an image composition

A bunch of common palettes
A selection of rare palettes
And a smaller set of ultra rare palettes
However, rarity will be based on what combinations the code produces

The majority of tokens will not have a special trait
However your token might have one or even multiple special traits
But, be aware that only the last special trait added will be listed in the features

Even then, look closely, because not all aspects of the canvas are included in the features. Collectors should still look closely and choose what they like when buying on secondary.

Which team are you on? X or O?

follow culla on twitter for updates. Or maybe __acolyte__

If the non reserved tokens mint out quickly, Access List mints will have 24 hours to mint reserves assigned to those wallets

Thank you for supporting an emerging artist in the generative art space

Access List reserves were given to holders of the following PFP collections created by culla
2x for each Basqunk held
1x for each Inkspunk, TwoFourQunk, V0iD, DeeManz, Punkasso and CR0$$KULL
You would have needed to transfer the above tokens to your mint wallet at the time of the snapshot

share your tokens on social media with #genxyznft
Made with love by culla using p5.js
